definition: Learning through working on open-ended, real-world problems that drive the acquisition of knowledge

positive_examples: Students were presented with a patient case and had to diagnose the condition.
The ill-structured problem had no single right answer.
They had to figure out what they needed to learn to solve the problem.
Real-world problems drive the need for new knowledge.
negative_examples: Solve problems 1-20 at the end of the chapter.
The teacher explained the concept, then gave practice problems.
training_hints.disambiguation: Open-ended problem drives learning, not exercises after instruction
